meanings.sent1: After a long day of lifting heavy boxes, his backaches were unbearable.
meanings.sent2: She visited the doctor for her persistent backaches.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those books gave him backaches, but at least he got stronger.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his worries felt like a thousand backaches on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The backaches from shoveling snow made him appreciate warm blankets even more.

meanings.definition: To experience pain in the back.
meanings.sent1: He backaches every time he bends down to tie his shoes.
meanings.sent2: She backaches after standing for hours at work.
meanings.sent3: His backaches whenever he tries to lift heavy objects.
meanings.sent4: The old chair backaches with every slight movement.
meanings.sent5: The tree backaches in the wind, its branches creaking in pain.

meanings.sent1: The heavy backpack was the main reason for her backaches.
meanings.sent2: The uncomfortable chair gave him backaches during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The backaches mattress made it hard for him to get a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: The backaches massage chair provided relief after a long day at work.
meanings.sent5: The backaches shoes were quickly discarded for more comfortable ones.
